comments:
I'm building activity diagrams and need to create instances of ReadVariableAction and WriteVariableAction.  The UML2FactoryImpl.create method used as follows works for ReadVariableAction but not for WriteVariableAction.  The switch statement in the UML2Factoryfactory's create() method does not include support for WriteVariableAction.  

ActivityNode an = a.createNode(UML2Package.eINSTANCE.getReadVariableAction()); 
ActivityNode an2 = a.createNode(UML2Package.eINSTANCE.getWriteVariableAction());

The second line above causes the following exception:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The class 'WriteVariableAction' is not a valid classifier
	at org.eclipse.uml2.impl.UML2FactoryImpl.create(UML2FactoryImpl.java:427)
	at org.eclipse.uml2.impl.ActivityImpl.createNode(ActivityImpl.java:418)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:349)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:226)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:311)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:214)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:311)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:316)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:196)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:196)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.processJavaClass(InitializeTest.java:196)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest$ModelInitializer.initialize(InitializeTest.java:375)
	at com.virtc.stm.ait.InitializeTest.testInitializer(InitializeTest.java:120)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at junit.framework.TestCase.runTest(TestCase.java:154)
	at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:127)
	at junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)
	at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
	at junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)
	at junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:118)
	at junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:208)
	at junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:203)

	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRunner.java:196)
WriteVariableAction is abstract, and as such cannot be instantiated. Use the Ecore class for one of its specializaions instead.

traces.message: The class 'WriteVariableAction' is not a valid classifier
